item.title: Coronavirus: Possible post-lockdown workplace rules revealed
item.description: Reduced hot-desking, staggered shifts and continued home-working form part of a draft government plan.

item.title: World must 'pull together' to back vaccine, PM says
item.description: World leaders sign up to a fundraising drive, which aims to raise $8.3bn over the next month.

item.title: Coronavirus: New lows for deaths in France, Spain and Italy
item.description: A French doctor says tests on samples from patients show the virus was present last year.

item.title: Coronavirus: Naples feels the cost of Italy's lockdown
item.description: As Italy eases its restrictions, the damage caused by lockdown is being felt across Naples.

item.title: Coronavirus: UK hospital trials new treatment drug
item.description: The new drug is based around a protein that is commonly used in the treatment of multiple sclerosis.

item.title: Coronavirus: Online students face full tuition fees
item.description: If universities are teaching online next term students will still have to pay full tuition fees.

item.title: Sir Cameron Mackintosh: 'Theatres could be closed until next year'
item.description: Sir Cameron Mackintosh says the industry can't plan for a return until social distancing is "gone".

item.title: Saleem Butt killing: Man charged with Batley murder
item.description: The victim, 61-year-old Saleem Butt, is described as a "lovely and very gentle" man.

item.title: Coronavirus: Air passengers told to wear face masks
item.description: Some airlines are now making it compulsory for travellers to put on masks when they resume travel.

item.title: HS2 protesters spending coronavirus lockdown in trees
item.description: Protesters against HS2 are still trying to save threatened forests during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: GMB's Piers Morgan steps back to await virus test result
item.description: The presenter says he's acting "out of an abundance of caution", after showing mild symptoms.

item.title: The Papers: Vaccine race and post-lockdown workplace rules
item.description: Boris Johnson's call for nations to unite to develop a coronavirus vaccine leads many front pages.

item.title: Coronavirus: Ghana's dancing pallbearers become Covid-19 meme
item.description: Social media users have adopted the troupe as a dark-humoured symbol of death in the time of Covid-19.

item.title: Black hair: Dealing with my curls during lockdown
item.description: Kezia is struggling to find the products she needs for her hair during lockdown due to black hair shops being closed.

item.title: High-schoolers take their proms online
item.description: With social distancing in place, teenagers are hosting their proms on Zoom.

item.title: Coronavirus: Photographing the neighbours during lockdown
item.description: A photographer captures her neighbours as they cope with being stuck at home during lockdown.

item.title: Coronavirus lockdown: How does it affect babies?
item.description: Educational psychologist and parent Dr Abigail Wright offers advice for families looking after babies in lockdown.

item.title: Coronavirus: Michael Palin shares his hospital stories for NHS charity book
item.description: The Monty Python shares his lighter moments in hospital, and how humour helps us all.

item.title: Coronavirus: How does contact tracing work and is my data safe?
item.description: Millions in the UK will soon be asked to download an app that helps to limit coronavirus spreading.

item.title: Coronavirus: How Covid-19 can hit the kidneys
item.description: Figures show more than 2,000 patients admitted to intensive care with Covid-19 suffered kidney failure.

item.title: How socially distanced stars are still making TV dramas in a crisis
item.description: Broadcasters find ways to film new shows - but screen dramas won't return to normal for a long time.

item.title: Single, pregnant and self-isolating
item.description: Carla Fitzgerald explains what it's like to be pregnant and single during lockdown.

item.title: Coronavirus: Changing faces after six weeks of lockdown
item.description: People have been sharing pictures of how their appearance has changed after weeks of restrictions.

item.title: Coronavirus: The seven types of people who start and spread viral misinformation
item.description: It's wrong but where does it come from? A guide to the types of people who spread so-called "fake news".

item.title: Coronavirus: Disease meets deforestation at heart of Brazil's Amazon
item.description: Coronavirus has overwhelmed Manaus, the Amazon's biggest city, and the worst is yet to come.

item.title: 'I just designed a destruction of a life'
item.description: The US designer who rebuilt his life after destroying it through cocaine and crystal meth addiction.

item.title: Coronavirus: Greece and Croatia acted fast, now need to save summer
item.description: Greece and Croatia reacted fast to coronavirus, but now it threatens their tourism industries.

item.title: Social distancing and coronavirus: The science behind the two-metre rule
item.description: Ministers are reportedly considering relaxing the two-metre rule for social distancing in workplaces.

item.title: Coronavirus: What global travel may look like ahead of a vaccine
item.description: As countries ease their coronavirus restrictions, what can would-be travellers expect to experience?

item.title: Two men and a dog chasing an Arctic dream in a lifeboat
item.description: Two architects bought a retired Scottish ferry lifeboat and converted it for the adventure of a lifetime.

item.title: Michael Wray: How a Hell's Kitchen winner ended up on the streets
item.description: Michael Wray won the first US series of Hell's Kitchen, but then his life took a turn for the worse.

item.title: Coronavirus doctor's diary: Take care when you clap for carers
item.description: Each Thursday's clap for carers leads to a flurry of activity in Accident and Emergency, says Dr John Wright.

item.title: Love Bug's creator tracked down to repair shop in Manila
item.description: Two decades after the world's first major computer virus, an author finds the perpetrator in Manila.

item.title: Hard to see fans returning to football matches any time soon - FA chairman
item.description: Football Association chairman Greg Clarke has said it is hard to see fans returning to matches "any time soon".

item.title: Best players, top moments & favourite goals - your Premier League & WSL awards
item.description: With award season in both the Premier League and the WSL currently on hold, BBC Sport want you to vote for your season highlights.

item.title: More clubs open to neutral venues if relegation threat removed
item.description: A growing number of Premier League clubs are open to playing the remaining fixtures at neutral venues but with the threat of relegation removed.

item.title: Racing could return within week of being given go-ahead - BHA chief
item.description: Racing could return to action a week after it is given any go-ahead to resume, according to the British Horseracing Authority's boss.

item.title: Man Utd to speak to Rojo over 'lockdown breach'
item.description: Manchester United will speak to defender Marcos Rojo about his conduct after apparently flouting Argentina's coronavirus lockdown rules.

item.title: Vandoorne crashes off pole position twice in eventful esports weekend
item.description: In one weekend Stoffel Vandoorne manages to qualify on pole position in two races and crash out of both of them.

item.title: Coronavirus: Can I still go to university in September? And other questions
item.description: Can I go to university in September, and other questions answered by BBC experts.

item.title: Coronavirus lockdown: Inventive routes back to normal life
item.description: Bubbles, vending machines and staggered school days - some methods are more innovative than others.

item.title: Coronavirus: Why did the UK need 100,000 tests a day?
item.description: What are the tests for coronavirus, who are they for and how do they work?

item.title: Coronavirus cure: When will we have a drug to treat it?
item.description: There are no drugs proven to help doctors treat the disease, but work is under way around the world.

item.title: Coronavirus UK map: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: Coronavirus: Intensive care and other key terms explained
item.description: Use our tool to check the meaning of key words and phrases associated with the Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: Coronavirus vaccine: When will we have one?
item.description: We answer some of the big questions about vaccines and how long one for coronavirus could take.

item.title: Coronavirus: Should the public wear face masks?
item.description: There is growing discussion about the potential benefits of the general public wearing masks.

item.title: Coronavirus pandemic: Tracking the global outbreak
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the respiratory virus has spread around the world and how it is being dealt with.

item.title: Coronavirus: The foster dad home-schooling 10 North Korean boys
item.description: As millions of parents grapple with the challenge of home-schooling, one has a very tough task.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'I never thought I'd be so proud to sell bread and butter'
item.description: Laura McLellan felt humbled when she and her team of checkout operators were told they were key workers.

item.title: 'Nobody told us about the coronavirus pandemic'
item.description: Before setting sail around the world, Elena and Ryan told their families not to give them bad news.

item.title: Coronavirus: Protecting the 'one in a million' girl
item.description: Bex Price's family went into isolation early as coronavirus would almost certainly kill her.

item.title: Coronavirus: Making face masks feels 'like the war effort'
item.description: Thousands of people are producing cloth masks, despite UK authorities saying they are unnecessary.

item.title: Coronavirus journey: The 'last cruise ship on Earth' finally comes home
item.description: From political storms to presidential pleas, it has been quite a journey for the MSC Magnifica.

item.title: The tiny premature baby who fought off coronavirus
item.description: Peyton Maguire from Lanarkshire is one of the youngest Covid-19 patients in the UK.

item.title: How Typhoid Mary left a trail of scandal and death
item.description: The chilling story of an Irish immigrant cook who brought typhoid to well-to-do families in New York.

item.title: Coronavirus: Grandmas' top tips to get through lockdown
item.description: We've asked Grannies from around the world for their advice on staying positive.

item.title: A coronavirus survivor's story: 'I touched death'
item.description: Elizabeth says she feels lucky to be alive after falling seriously ill with the virus.

item.title: Coronavirus: Wacky and wonderful scrubs for NHS workers
item.description: Hundreds of volunteers are making scrubs of all different designs and colours for doctors and nurses.
